subject: RE: The goals of CMM (Re: [junit] wanted Junit professionals urgently)
msgSnippet: ... To my knowledge, Exploratory Testing is performed at the GUI level, so the tester would have to log widget events. Anyway, I once proposed this exact thing
messageBody:
> From: Vladimir Ritz Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
>
> > When they did find defects using this technique, they
> > were usually unable to reproduce them because they couldn't
> remember
> > the exact steps they had followed to get where they were.
>
> A good logging strategy would have certainly helped. For
> example having
> a detailed log of the invoked methods (with parameters) should enable
> you to reproduce what happened.

To my knowledge, Exploratory Testing is performed at the GUI level, so
the tester would have to log widget events. Anyway, I once proposed this
exact thing to some ET proponents. The idea was met with negative
enthusiasm.
